meanings.definition: Make an abrupt, unsteady, jerky movement.
meanings.sent1: The boat was lurching in the rough waves.
meanings.sent2: The car started lurching forward when the driver pressed the gas pedal.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was lurching around the room, trying to keep his balance.
meanings.sent4: The old truck was lurching along the bumpy road, struggling to maintain speed.
meanings.sent5: The injured bird was lurching towards its nest, determined to reach safety.

meanings.sent1: The drunk man was lurching down the street, unable to walk straight.
meanings.sent2: The tired hiker was lurching up the steep hill, one step at a time.
meanings.sent3: The robot was lurching across the room, malfunctioning in a comical way.
meanings.sent4: The ghostly figure was lurching towards the frightened children, sending shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The injured deer was lurching through the forest, seeking a safe place to rest.
